intro: Oreodaphne glaberrima var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed oreodaphne, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree characterized by its elliptical, glossy, dark green leaves that are typically narrow and pointed. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It is native to Southeast Asia, including parts of Malaysia and Indonesia, and thrives in tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
